remarks: A formal system is a tuple ` <. mCN , mVR , mType , mVT , mTC , mAx >. ` such that: ` mCN ` and ` mVR ` are disjoint; ` mType ` is a function from ` mVR ` to ` mVT ` ; ` mVT ` is a subset of ` mTC ` ; ` mAx ` is a set of statements; and for each variable typecode, there are infinitely many variables of that type.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Jul-2016.)
statement:
ismfs.c $e |- C = ( mCN ` T ) $.
ismfs.v $e |- V = ( mVR ` T ) $.
ismfs.y $e |- Y = ( mType ` T ) $.
ismfs.f $e |- F = ( mVT ` T ) $.
ismfs.k $e |- K = ( mTC ` T ) $.
ismfs.a $e |- A = ( mAx ` T ) $.
ismfs.s $e |- S = ( mStat ` T ) $.
ismfs $p |- ( T e. W -> ( T e. mFS <-> ( ( ( C i^i V ) = (/) /\ Y : V --> K ) /\ ( A C_ S /\ A. v e. F -. ( `' Y " { v } ) e. Fin ) ) ) ) $.
